article:
' Dark Side of the Moon Live world tour, Roskilde Festival 2006,
Denmark]] 'Carol Kenyon' (sometimes spelt Karol), is a British singer.
She was born c. 1959.

Although primarily known as a session vocalist on many albums and singles by a
variety of prominent artists, as well as in many concerts, Kenyon has also
released several singles as a solo artist. Her first single was "Warrior Woman"
which was released on A&M Records in 1984. Steward, Sue &
Garratt, Sheryl (1985) Signed, Sealed, and Delivered: True Life Stories of Women
in Pop, South End Press, ISBN 978-0-89608-240-3, p. 53

She is best known for her vocals on the Heaven 17 hit song "Temptation", which
reached number two in the UK Singles Chart in 1983. Buckley, Peter (2003) The Rough Guide to Rock, Rough Guides,
ISBN 978-1-84353-105-0, p. 483

Her early performances were as part of the National Youth Jazz Orchestra. She
has also sung with Go West (band), Duran Duran, Kylie Minogue, Mike Oldfield,
Jon and Vangelis, Pet Shop Boys, Gary Moore, Dexys Midnight Runners, Pink Floyd,
Tommy Shaw, Roger Waters, Morrissey-Mullen, Tears for Fears, Heaven 17, Paul
Hardcastle and Van Morrison. In 1993, Ms Kenyon appeared with David Suchet in
Agatha Christie's Poirot novella "Yellow Iris".
